comments.comment: In the 1960s and 70s, travelers from UK chose to travel to Australia via Colombo because that was the fastest route. Kangaroo route (UK-Australia) is one of the world's busiest twin-city travel routes. Even now, the shortest route between UK and Australia falls via Colombo. More than 20 airlines, including Chinese and Indian airlines are currently plying the Kangaroo route but Sri Lankan has an advantage because Colombo is right in the middle of the route and it will be the fastest. So if Sri Lankan Airlines can successfully tap the travel market between London and Australia, like Air Ceylon did in the past, we can come back to the old glory again!
This is the good news and great decision, more people live in Australia and they can use this travel facility. Many thanks Sri Lankan Management
No more Negombo boats required then..  :p

That's a very good idea. also Srilankan airline must start again from Frankfurt to colombo. here they stop Frankfurt, Zurich, Rome, Milano, Paris so we have to fly via middle east and no direct flight from Europe accept London. In this matter we don't have much tourist from Europe and they fly to Bangkok. Please think about this matter as well and with my own experience these all flights are fully booked at all times and profitable. think about please.
need at least A350 or A340 for comfortable travel
Quite a good decision. Lot of time is wasted on S,pore during transit. Appears air time seems to be about 11 hrs. Thanks.
If we had and was able to land A 380, could have been very competitive
Really speaking it is better to go via transit if you use economy class as good break during the trip
11 hours is good if you don't travel with young kids
No it's only 9 hours Check the timing difference

Not really. currently with transit time it takes from 16 to and some instance 30+ hours to travel from Adelaide to Colombo with Malaysian airlines, if you get a good price it is always long layover in Malaysia and another in Perth. IF SL Airlines keep the fares to match with Singapore & Malaysian air lines, will be a good start and I will fly from Melbourne to Colombo any time.
Sri Lankan air lines should think of starting direct flights to South Korea as well.
